question:
A global ecommerce company runs its critical workloads on AWS. The workloads use an Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL DB instance that is configured for a Multi-AZ deployment.

Customers have reported application timeouts when the company undergoes database failovers. The company needs a resilient solution to reduce failover time.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Create an Amazon RDS Proxy. Assign the proxy to the DB instance.
options.B: Create a read replica for the DB instance. Move the read traffic to the read replica.
options.C: Enable Performance Insights. Monitor the CPU load to identify the timeouts.
options.D: Take regular automatic snapshots. Copy the automatic snapshots to multiple AWS Regions.

explanation: RDS Proxy maintains a pool of database connections and handles failover transparently, reducing failover time from minutes to seconds. It manages connection multiplexing and failover, preventing application timeouts during database failovers.
